summary: Hydroxyzine, sold as Atarax or Vistaril, is a medicine used to treat itchiness, anxiety, trouble sleeping, and nausea. It can be taken by mouth or injected into a muscle. This drug works by blocking histamine, a chemical in the body that causes allergies. Common side effects include sleepiness, headache, and dry mouth. It was first made in 1956 and is widely used, being the 46th most prescribed medication in the U.S. in 2022.
title: Hydroxyzine
